author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the guidelines for auto-merging. Please make sure that you have read the [General registry README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md) and the [AutoMerge guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/). The following guidelines were not met:

- Name is not at least 5 characters long
- Package name similar to 1 existing package.
  1. Similar to Dolo. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

After you have fixed the AutoMerge issues, simple retrigger Registrator, which will automatically update this pull request. You do not need to change the version number in your `Project.toml` file (unless of course the AutoMerge issue is that you skipped a version number, in which case you should change the version number).

If you do not want to fix the AutoMerge issues, please post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have also read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

Hi! this is my first package, the auto merge failed because of the following:

---
1. Name is not at least five characters long
2. The following dependencies do not have a [compat] entry that is upper-bounded and only includes a finite number of     breaking releases: EzXML, ZipFile
3. Package name similar to 1 existing package.
  Similar to Dolo. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
---

I think 1) and 3) should not be enforced because the `*.docx` extension is a widely know format produced by MS Word and Libre and Open office suites. I don't think adding a `Document` or some other suffix or prefix so that the package is named `DocxDocument` or `DocumentDocx` or `WordDocx` would disambiguate it any further.

For 2) I'll be pushing an update to add an upper bound to the `[compat]` section of those packages, after I add that section should I update this PR's commit hash? or should I create a new one?

> For 2) I'll be pushing an update to add an upper bound to the [compat] section of those packages, after I add that section should I update this PR's commit hash? or should I create a new one?

Fix the compat bounds, then trigger registration again without changing version number, that will automatically update this pull request
An unexpected error occurred during registration.

@giordano Hope everything has been alright! its been a while but after fixing the compat issues AutoMerge failed with the following message:

```
Package name similar to 1 existing package.
1. Similar to Dolo. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
```

And while I agree that the package name is short, I think that the name Docx is not ambiguous at all because `*.docx` is a well known file extension used my Microsoft Word, LibreOffice Writer and OpenOffice Writer. Since this is the only remaining issue I think that the package registry should be merged manually.

You're always missing

> The following dependencies do not have a [compat] entry that is upper-bounded and only includes a finite number of breaking releases: EzXML, ZipFile

@giordano Thank you for your patience, I think I've finally fixed the upper bound issues ... took me a while to figure out from the docs.

I think the only one which requires manual intervention is the check for the name.

> I think I've finally fixed the upper bound issues ... took me a while to figure out from the docs.

I don't think so, the automerge comment always shows

> The following dependencies do not have a [compat] entry that is upper-bounded and only includes a finite number of breaking releases: EzXML, ZipFile

since April 3rd, it never changed since then

@triztian you'll need to trigger registrator by commenting `@juliaregistrator register`, *not here*, but in a comment on the commit in which you've fixed the upper bound issue, e.g. https://github.com/triztian/Docx.jl/commit/208f7ebeb88146b9f82d816d96d8999f07973010

I'm actually a bit unsure if the specification you use there with the `>=` and `<` is valid (c.f. https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1.6/compatibility/) but you can give it a try.

edit: actually, I'm pretty sure there are infinitely many breaking releases in the set `[0.3.9, 1.0)`, regardless of syntax, because 0.x releases are breaking by SemVer, and there are infinitely many possible 0.x releases between 0.3 and 1.0.

Given what the current versions are for each package, I might suggest something along the lines of simply
```
ZipFile = "0.3" 
EzXML = "1"
```
i.e., all non-breaking releases in the 0.3.x series for the former, and all non-breaking releases in the 1.x.x series for the latter.

[noblock]

Hah, I thought quoting would stop registrator from thinking I meant it here but I guess not

[noblock]

> I'm actually a bit unsure if the specification you use there with the >= and < is valid (c.f. pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1.6/compatibility) but you can give it a try.

They should _**not**_ be used in the registry, because they allow infinite-many breaking changes.  You have to explicitly list all compatible breaking changes of the dependencies.

[noblock]

Hi @giordano I think the upper bound issues have been finally resolved, from the looks of the error message [here](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/33477/checks?check_run_id=2901758746) it seems like we're back to the naming being to similar to `Dolo` which I believe requires manual intervention from a registry admin.

Thank you for the patience and @brenhinkeller for the details and pointers so far!

body:
- Registering package: Docx
- Repository: https://github.com/triztian/Docx.jl
- Created by: @triztian
- Version: v0.1.0
- Commit: ba144c6a41865e0d5e2be41189801eb96ff7b849
- Git reference: main
- Release notes:
<!-- BEGIN RELEASE NOTES -->
> Alpha and minimally usable version for reading Docx
> NOTICE: THIS SOFTWARE IS UNDER DEVELOPMENT AND ITS API IS NOT YET STABLE
<!-- END RELEASE NOTES -->
title: New package: Docx v0.1.0
